docTitle.name: shortTitle
docTitle.content: Veterinary Surgeons Board (Election of Members) Regulation

subsection.leadIn: In this Regulation—
subsection.def: assistant returning officer (助理選舉主任), in relation to an election, means an assistant returning officer appointed under section 68(1) for the election;
ballot paper (選票) means a specified form by means of which an elector for an election is to cast the elector’s vote in the election;
by-election (補選)—see section 4;
Cap. 554 (第554章) means the Elections (Corrupt and Illegal Conduct) Ordinance (Cap. 554);
election (選舉) means—(a)an ordinary election; or(b)a by-election;
election petition (選舉呈請) means an election petition presented under section 56(1);
elector (選舉人)—see section 5;
nomination form (提名表格) means a specified form for nominating a person as a candidate for an election;
nomination period (提名期)—see section 6;
notice of election (選舉通知) means a notice issued under section 9(1);
ordinary election (一般選舉)—see section 3;
polling period (遞交選票期)—see section 7;
practising certificate (執業證明書) means a practising certificate that is issued under section 12 of the Ordinance and is in force;
returning officer (選舉主任), in relation to an election, means the returning officer appointed under section 67(2) for the election;
rules (《規則》) means the rules made under section 6(c) of the Ordinance;
specified end date (指明終結日期)—see section 8;
specified form (指明表格) means a form specified under section 66;
specified officer (指明人員), in relation to an election, means the returning officer for the election or an assistant returning officer for the election;
vacancy (空缺) means a vacancy in the office of an elected member, and includes a vacancy that is to arise on the expiry of the term of office of such a member;
working day (工作日) means any Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday or Friday (other than a general holiday).

subsection.leadIn: In this Regulation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a reference to a period beginning on a day is a reference to a period beginning at 0000 hours on that day; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a reference to a period ending on a day is a reference to a period ending at 2400 hours on that day.

subsection.content: The first election to elect all the members under section 3A(1)(c) of the Ordinance (relevant section) is an ordinary election.

Any other election (other than a by-election) is also an ordinary election if it is held, or to be held, to elect persons to fill the vacancies in the offices of all the members under the relevant section.

section.name: s4
section.heading: By-election
section.leadIn: A by-election is an election that is held, or to be held—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the purposes of section 3E(2) of the Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: under section 62; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to elect, in any other case, one or more persons to fill the vacancy or vacancies in the office or offices of one or more (but not all) elected members.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Elector
section.leadIn: A person is an elector for an election if, on the 30th day before the date of the notice of election—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person’s name is on the register; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person holds a practising certificate.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Nomination period
section.leadIn: The nomination period for an election is a period of not less than 28 days—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: beginning on the date of the notice of election; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to section 73(1), ending on a date specified by the Board.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Polling period
section.content: Subject to section 73(1), the polling period for an election is a period of not less than 45 days as specified by the Board.

subsection.content: The specified end date is the last day of the term of office of the member or members elected in the last ordinary election.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (1)—
subsection.def: term of office (任期) means the term of office mentioned in section 3E(1) of the Ordinance.

subsection.content: For an election, the returning officer must issue a notice of election to every elector.

subsection.leadIn: The notice of election must contain the following information—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the number of vacancies to be filled in the election;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the reason for the election;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the nomination period for the election;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the polling period for the election; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: any other information that the Board considers appropriate.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 3
section.def: date of nomination (提名日期), in relation to a nomination of a person, means the date stated in the nomination form as the date on which the nomination is made;
notice of nomination result (提名結果通知) means a notice issued under section 18.

subsection.content: The nomination of a person as a candidate for an election must be made by means of a nomination form.

subsection.leadIn: The nomination form must satisfy the following conditions—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is signed by an elector as the proposer and another elector as the seconder;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is completed, and submitted, in accordance with the rules; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: it is received by the returning officer before the time on the last day of the nomination period, as specified by the Board.

subsection.leadIn: The person being nominated under subsection (1) (nominee)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must indicate the nominee’s consent to the nomination by signing the nomination form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must make, in the nomination form, a declaration in relation to the nominee’s eligibility for nomination.

subsection.content: The nominee must not be the proposer or the seconder of the nomination.

subsection.leadIn: An elector may nominate a person as a candidate for an election only if, on the date of nomination—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the elector’s name is on the register; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the elector holds a practising certificate.

subsection.leadIn: An elector has nominated a person as a candidate for an election if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the elector has signed, as the proposer or the seconder, a nomination form for the nomination; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the nomination form has been submitted to the returning officer.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (4) and (5), an elector (relevant elector)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if there is 1 vacancy in the election—may nominate only 1 person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if there are 2 or more vacancies in the election—may nominate not more than 2 persons.

subsection.leadIn: If the nomination of a person (original nominee) by means of a nomination form signed by the relevant elector is determined under section 15(3)(a) to be invalid, the relevant elector may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: nominate another person as a candidate for the election; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: nominate again the original nominee as a candidate for the election.

subsection.leadIn: If there is any of the following circumstances in relation to the original nominee, the relevant elector may nominate another person as a candidate for the election—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the original nominee withdraws candidature under section 14;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the nomination of the original nominee by means of a nomination form signed by the relevant elector is rejected under section 15(7);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the nomination of the original nominee by means of a nomination form signed by the relevant elector is determined under section 15(3)(b) or 16 to be invalid.

subsection.leadIn: A person may be nominated as a candidate for an election if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the person’s name is on the register—

subparagraph.content: on 31 December of the second year before the year in which the notice of election is issued (election year);
on 31 December of the year before the election year;
on the 30th day before the date of the notice of election; and
on the date of nomination;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person holds a practising certificate on all those days; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: at any time within the 3-year period ending on the date of nomination, the person has practised veterinary surgery or provided a veterinary service in Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: However, a person may not be nominated as a candidate for an election if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person is an undischarged bankrupt on the date of nomination;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: there is in force on the date of nomination a voluntary arrangement within the meaning of the Bankruptcy Ordinance (Cap. 6) between the person and the person’s creditors;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: on the date of nomination, there is on the register a record of a removal order made under section 19(a) or (b) of the Ordinance in respect of the person, and the date on which the person’s name was removed under the order is within the 3-year period ending on the date of nomination;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: on the date of nomination, there is on the register a record of a reprimand made under section 19(c) of the Ordinance in respect of the person, and the date of the reprimand is within the 3-year period ending on the date of nomination;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: an order under section 19(d) of the Ordinance has been made in respect of the person within the 3-year period ending on the date of nomination, and the order has not been reversed by a court;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the person has been sentenced, within the 5-year period ending on the date of nomination, to imprisonment for a term exceeding 3 months;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the person has been convicted, within the 5-year period ending on the date of nomination, of an offence of having engaged in corrupt conduct or illegal conduct in contravention of Cap. 554; or

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: for a by-election—the person is a member of the Board.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (2)(f), it does not matter—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether the person is sentenced in Hong Kong or in any other place;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whether the sentence is suspended or not; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: what the imprisonment is called.

subsection.content: A person who is nominated as a candidate for an election may withdraw candidature by giving a written notice to any of the specified officers.

subsection.leadIn: The notice must satisfy the following conditions—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is completed, and given, in accordance with the rules;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: it is signed by the person in the presence of any specified officer; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: it is received by any specified officer before the time on the day following the last day of the nomination period, as specified by the Board.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Determination as to validity of nomination

subsection.content: On receiving a nomination form submitted for an election, the returning officer must determine whether the person nominated by means of the form (relevant person) is validly nominated as a candidate for the election.
The returning officer may make any inquiry that the returning officer considers necessary for determining whether the relevant person is validly nominated.

subsection.leadIn: The returning officer must determine under subsection (1) that the relevant person is not validly nominated if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 11 or 12 is not complied with in relation to the nomination; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: it is proved to the satisfaction of the returning officer that—

subparagraph.content: the relevant person has died;
the relevant person is, under section 13, not eligible for nomination; or
at any time after the nomination of the relevant person, there is any of the circumstances specified in section 75 in relation to the person.

subsection.content: If the returning officer makes a determination under subsection (1), the returning officer must issue a written notice to the relevant person notifying the person of the determination.
If the returning officer determines that the relevant person is not validly nominated, the notice must state the ground of the determination.
Subsections (4) and (5) do not apply if the relevant person has died.

If the returning officer determines under subsection (1) that the nomination of the relevant person is valid, the returning officer must reject any other nomination form by means of which the person is nominated for the election.

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the returning officer for an election has determined under section 15(1) that a person is validly nominated as a candidate for the election; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: before the issue of the notice of nomination result, it is proved to the satisfaction of the returning officer that—

subparagraph.content: the person has died;
the person is, under section 13, not eligible for nomination; or
at any time after the nomination of the person, there is any of the circumstances specified in section 75 in relation to the person.

subsection.leadIn: The returning officer must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: revoke the determination and determine that the person is not validly nominated as a candidate for the election;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: issue a written notice to the person notifying the person of the revocation and the invalidity of the person’s nomination; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: state in the notice the ground of the revocation.

subsection.content: Subsection (2)(b) and (c) does not apply if the person has died.

section.name: s17
section.heading: Meaning of candidate in Division 3 of Part 3
section.def: candidate (候選人), in relation to an election, means a person who satisfies the following conditions—(a)the person is determined to be validly nominated under section 15(1) for the election;(b)the determination is not revoked under section 16; and(c)the person has not withdrawn candidature under section 14.

section.name: s18
section.heading: Notice of nomination result
section.content: The returning officer must, within 14 days after the nomination period, issue a notice of the result of the nominations to every elector.

section.name: s19
section.heading: Poll to be conducted in contested election

subsection.content: A poll is to be conducted under Part 4 for an election if the number of candidates exceeds the number of vacancies in the election.

subsection.leadIn: However, a poll is not required to be conducted under Part 4 for an election if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the nomination result is varied under Division 4; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: as a result of the variation, the number of remaining candidates no longer exceeds the number of vacancies.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (2)—
subsection.def: remaining candidate (剩餘候選人), in relation to an election, means a candidate for the election in respect of whom the determination under section 15(1) is not revoked under section 24.

section.name: s20
section.heading: If number of candidates equals number of vacancies

subsection.content: This section applies if the number of candidates equals the number of vacancies in an election.

subsection.leadIn: On the date of the notice of nomination result, the returning officer must, by written notice—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: declare the result of the election and that the candidates are elected as elected members; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: declare that the election is concluded.

subsection.content: The notice of the declarations under subsection (2) must state the name of each of the elected members.
The returning officer must also send a copy of the notice of the declarations under subsection (2) to every elector.

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is one or more candidates for an election; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the number of vacancies exceeds the number of the candidates.

subsection.leadIn: On the date of the notice of nomination result, the returning officer must, by written notice—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: declare the result of the election (including the number of remaining vacancies) and that the candidates are elected as elected members; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: declare that the election is concluded.

subsection.content: The notice of the declarations under subsection (2) must state the name of each of the elected members.
The returning officer must send a copy of the notice of the declarations under subsection (2) to every elector.
The returning officer must also notify the Board in writing of the number of remaining vacancies.
If the election is an ordinary election, a by-election is to be held by the Board to fill the remaining vacancies.
If the election is a by-election, subject to subsection (8), a further round of by-election is to be held by the Board to fill the remaining vacancies.
A by-election may be held under subsection (7) only if the period beginning on the date of the notice of nomination result and ending on the specified end date is not less than 9 months.
This section applies if there is no candidate for an election.
On the date of the notice of nomination result, the returning officer must, by written notice, declare that the election is countermanded because there is no candidate for the election.
The returning officer must send a copy of the notice of the declaration under subsection (2) to every elector.
The returning officer must also notify the Board in writing that the election is countermanded.
If the election is an ordinary election, a further round of ordinary election is to be held by the Board to fill the vacancies.
If the election is a by-election, subject to subsection (7), a further round of by-election is to be held by the Board to fill the vacancies.
A by-election may be held under subsection (6) only if the period beginning on the date of the notice of nomination result and ending on the specified end date is not less than 9 months.

section.name: s23
section.heading: Interpretation of Division 4 of Part 3
section.def: notice of variation of nomination result (更改提名結果通知) means a notice issued under section 24(4);
remaining candidate (剩餘候選人) has the meaning given by section 19(3).

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the notice of nomination result for an election has been issued;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: before the polling period, it is proved to the satisfaction of the returning officer that—

subparagraph.content: a relevant candidate has died;
a relevant candidate is, under section 13, not eligible for nomination; or
at any time after the nomination of a relevant candidate, there is any of the circumstances specified in section 75 in relation to the candidate; and
declared under section 20(2) or 21(2) to be concluded; or
declared under section 22(2) to be countermanded.

subsection.leadIn: The returning officer must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: revoke the determination under section 15(1) in respect of the relevant candidate and determine that the relevant candidate is not validly nominated as a candidate for the election;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: issue a written notice to the relevant candidate notifying the candidate of the revocation and the invalidity of the candidate’s nomination; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: state in the notice the ground of the revocation.

subsection.content: Subsection (2)(b) and (c) does not apply if the relevant candidate has died.
The returning officer must also issue to every elector a notice of variation of the nomination result notifying the elector of the revocation.
The notice of variation of nomination result must state the name of the relevant candidate.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: relevant candidate (有關候選人) means a person who satisfies the conditions described in the definition of candidate in section 17.

section.name: s25
section.heading: If number of candidates equals number of vacancies after variation

subsection.content: This section applies if, as a result of a variation under section 24, the number of remaining candidates equals the number of vacancies in an election.

subsection.leadIn: On the date of the notice of variation of nomination result, the returning officer must, by written notice—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: declare the result of the election and that the candidates are elected as elected members; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: declare that the election is concluded.

subsection.content: The notice of the declarations under subsection (2) must state the name of each of the elected members.
The returning officer must also send a copy of the notice of the declarations under subsection (2) to every elector.

section.name: s26
section.heading: If vacancies outnumber candidates after variation

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: as a result of a variation under section 24, there is one or more remaining candidates for an election; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the number of vacancies exceeds the number of the remaining candidates.

subsection.leadIn: On the date of the notice of variation of nomination result, the returning officer must, by written notice—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: declare the result of the election (including the number of remaining vacancies) and that the candidates are elected as elected members; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: declare that the election is concluded.

subsection.content: The notice of the declarations under subsection (2) must state the name of each of the elected members.
The returning officer must send a copy of the notice of the declarations under subsection (2) to every elector.
The returning officer must also notify the Board in writing of the number of remaining vacancies.
If the election is an ordinary election, a by-election is to be held by the Board to fill the remaining vacancies.
If the election is a by-election, subject to subsection (8), a further round of by-election is to be held by the Board to fill the remaining vacancies.
A by-election may be held under subsection (7) only if the period beginning on the date of the notice of variation of nomination result and ending on the specified end date is not less than 9 months.

section.name: s27
section.heading: If there is no candidate after variation

subsection.content: This section applies if, as a result of a variation under section 24, there is no remaining candidate for an election.

On the date of the notice of variation of nomination result, the returning officer must, by written notice, declare that the election is countermanded because there is no remaining candidate for the election.
The returning officer must send a copy of the notice of the declaration under subsection (2) to every elector.
The returning officer must also notify the Board in writing that the election is countermanded.
If the election is an ordinary election, a further round of ordinary election is to be held by the Board to fill the vacancies.
If the election is a by-election, subject to subsection (7), a further round of by-election is to be held by the Board to fill the vacancies.
A by-election may be held under subsection (6) only if the period beginning on the date of the notice of variation of nomination result and ending on the specified end date is not less than 9 months.

section.name: s28
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 4
section.def: ballot items (投票物品) means—(a)a ballot paper;(b)a declaration form;(c)an inner envelope; and(d)an outer envelope;
candidate (候選人) has the meaning given to the definition of remaining candidate by section 19(3);
declaration form (聲明書) means a specified form by means of which an elector is to declare that any vote recorded on the ballot paper submitted by the elector is cast by the elector;
inner envelope (內信封) means an envelope for enclosing a ballot paper for submission to the returning officer;
outer envelope (外信封) means an envelope for enclosing a declaration form, an inner envelope and a ballot paper, for submission to the returning officer;
service address (送達地址) means the address provided to the Board by a registered veterinary surgeon for receiving a document from the Board.

section.name: s29
section.heading: Application of Part 4
section.content: This Part applies if a poll is required to be conducted for an election.

division.name: D2
division.heading: Issue of Ballot Items etc. and Replacement

subsection.leadIn: Within the first 3 working days of the polling period, the returning officer must issue to every elector—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a set of ballot items; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a notice of the poll (polling notice).

subsection.leadIn: The polling notice must contain the following information—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the polling period;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: instructions on casting votes; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other information that the Board considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: The set of ballot items and a copy of the polling notice—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be sent to an elector by registered post addressed to the elector’s service address; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: are taken to be sent immediately after they are dispatched by registered post.

section.name: s31
section.heading: If ballot item is spoilt etc.
section.content: An elector may make, in accordance with the rules, to a specified officer a request for another set of ballot items if the elector has inadvertently marked, mutilated, or otherwise spoilt, any of the ballot items that are issued to the elector.

section.name: s32
section.heading: Power to entertain request made under section 31

subsection.content: A specified officer may entertain a request made under section 31 only if all the ballot items that are issued to the elector have been returned to any specified officer in accordance with the rules.
If the specified officer entertains the request, the officer may issue to the elector another set of ballot items (replacement set).

subsection.leadIn: The replacement set may either—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be collected in person by the elector or a person acting on the elector’s behalf at the address specified in the rules for the purpose; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be sent to the elector by registered post addressed to the elector’s service address.

subsection.content: The issue of the replacement set invalidates the set of ballot items previously issued to the elector.

section.name: s33
section.heading: If ballot item is lost or not received
section.leadIn: An elector may make, in accordance with the rules, to a specified officer a request for another set of ballot items if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any of the ballot items that are issued to the elector is lost; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the elector does not receive any of the ballot items that are issued to the elector.

section.name: s34
section.heading: Power to entertain request made under section 33

subsection.leadIn: A specified officer may entertain a request made under section 33 only if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the elector makes, in the presence of the officer, the following declaration in the specified form—

subparagraph.content: for section 33(a)—that one or more of the ballot items that are issued to the elector are lost; or
for section 33(b)—that one or more of the ballot items that are issued to the elector are not received by the elector; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the elector gives to the officer an undertaking in the specified form that the elector will only submit 1 ballot paper for casting vote in the election.

subsection.content: If the specified officer entertains the request, the officer may issue to the elector another set of ballot items (new set).
The elector may then collect in person the new set at the address specified in the rules for the purpose.
The issue of the new set invalidates the set of ballot items previously issued to the elector.
The new set is invalidated if the declaration made by the elector under subsection (1)(a) is found by any specified officer to be false.

section.name: s35
section.heading: Elector may vote for one or more candidates

subsection.content: An elector may vote for one or more candidates.
Despite subsection (1), the number of candidates that the elector votes for must not exceed the number of vacancies in the election.
An elector may cast a vote by submitting a ballot paper to the returning officer.

subsection.leadIn: The ballot paper must satisfy the following conditions—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is completed, and submitted, in accordance with the rules;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is accompanied by a declaration form signed by the elector; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: it is received by the returning officer before the time on the last day of the polling period, as specified by the Board.

subsection.content: Each elector may only submit 1 ballot paper for casting vote in an election.
If, in an election, the returning officer receives from an elector 2 or more ballot papers for casting vote in the election, all those ballot papers are invalid.

division.name: D4
division.heading: Death or Disqualification of Candidate During or After Polling Period

section.name: s37
section.heading: Death or disqualification during polling period

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if, during the polling period, it is proved to the satisfaction of the returning officer that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a candidate has died;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a candidate is, under section 13, not eligible for nomination; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: at any time after the nomination of a candidate, there is any of the circumstances specified in section 75 in relation to the candidate.

subsection.leadIn: The returning officer must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by written notice, declare that the election is countermanded;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: state in the notice the ground of the declaration; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: send a copy of the notice to every elector.

subsection.content: The returning officer must also notify the Board in writing that the election is countermanded.
If the election is an ordinary election, a further round of ordinary election is to be held by the Board to fill the vacancies.
If the election is a by-election, subject to subsection (6), a further round of by-election is to be held by the Board to fill the vacancies.
A by-election may be held under subsection (5) only if the period beginning on the date of the declaration under subsection (2) and ending on the specified end date is not less than 9 months.

section.name: s38
section.heading: Death or disqualification after polling period

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if, after the polling period, it is proved to the satisfaction of the returning officer that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a candidate has died;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a candidate is, under section 13, not eligible for nomination; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: at any time after the nomination of a candidate, there is any of the circumstances specified in section 75 in relation to the candidate.

subsection.content: The proceedings for the election are not to be terminated only because any of the circumstances mentioned in subsection (1)(a), (b) and (c) is proved to the satisfaction of the returning officer.
If the counting of votes has not begun or has not been completed, the counting is to begin or continue.

If, after the counting of votes has been completed, the votes cast for the candidate would have been sufficient for returning the candidate if this section had not applied, subsections (5), (6), (7), (8) and (9) apply.

subsection.leadIn: The returning officer must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by written notice, declare that the election is countermanded;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: state in the notice the ground of the declaration; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: send a copy of the notice to every elector.

subsection.content: The returning officer must also notify the Board in writing that the election is countermanded.
If the election is an ordinary election, a further round of ordinary election is to be held by the Board to fill the vacancies.
If the election is a by-election, subject to subsection (9), a further round of by-election is to be held by the Board to fill the vacancies.
A by-election may be held under subsection (8) only if the period beginning on the date of the declaration under subsection (5) and ending on the specified end date is not less than 9 months.

section.name: s39
section.heading: Place and time of counting of votes

subsection.content: Within 30 days after the polling period, the returning officer must verify, record and count the number of votes cast for each candidate.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 70, any of the following persons may be present at the counting of votes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a candidate;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other person that the returning officer considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: The returning officer must notify every candidate in writing—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: of the place, date and time of the counting of votes; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that, subject to section 70, the candidate may be present at the counting of votes.

subsection.content: The presence or absence of any person at the counting of votes does not affect the validity of the result.

subsection.leadIn: The returning officer must reject a ballot paper if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of the elector to whom the ballot paper has been issued (relevant elector) is not on the register on the last day of the polling period;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the relevant elector does not hold a practising certificate on the last day of the polling period;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any of the ballot items is invalid under section 32(4) or 34(4) or (5);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any of the conditions specified in section 36(2) is not satisfied in relation to the ballot paper;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the ballot paper is invalid under section 36(4);

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: any of the ballot items is substantially mutilated;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: any of the ballot items has been altered;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: the inner envelope or the ballot paper has any writing or mark by which, in the opinion of the returning officer, the elector can possibly be identified;
the number of candidates chosen in the ballot paper exceeds the number of vacancies in the election;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: the ballot paper is unmarked or not clearly marked; or

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: the returning officer determines that any vote recorded on the ballot paper is void for uncertainty.

subsection.content: In determining whether to reject a ballot paper under subsection (1), the returning officer must act in conformity with the rules.
A vote recorded on a ballot paper that is rejected under subsection (1) must not be counted.

subsection.leadIn: Only votes recorded on a ballot paper that satisfies the following conditions may be counted—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is issued under section 30, 32 or 34 (as the case requires) (relevant section); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is accompanied by a declaration form, an inner envelope and an outer envelope that are issued under the relevant section.

subsection.content: Before a declaration is made under section 38, 47 or 48, a candidate may request the returning officer to count again the votes already counted.
The returning officer must entertain a request made under subsection (1) unless the returning officer considers it unreasonable.
Section 39(2) and (4) applies to the counting of votes under this section.

section.name: s42
section.heading: How to ascertain result of election
section.content: The returning officer must, after a poll for an election is conducted, ascertain the result of the election in accordance with sections 43, 44, 45 and 46.

section.name: s43
section.heading: More votes, higher priority
section.content: A candidate who has obtained more votes at a poll has a higher priority of being declared to be elected as an elected member.

section.name: s44
section.heading: If candidates with highest number of votes do not outnumber vacancies

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: 2 or more candidates have obtained the highest number of votes at a poll; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the number of vacancies in the election exceeds or is the same as the number of those candidates,

section.continued: all those candidates must be declared to be elected as elected members.

section.name: s45
section.heading: If candidates obtain same number of votes in other case

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: 2 or more candidates have obtained the same number of votes at a poll; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: because of section 43, the returning officer cannot declare any of them to be elected as an elected member.

subsection.content: The returning officer must determine which of the candidates under subsection (1)(a) (relevant candidates) is or are to be elected by drawing lots.
A relevant candidate on whom the lot falls is to be declared to be elected as an elected member.

subsection.leadIn: The drawing of lots must be conducted—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the Chairperson is not a registered veterinary surgeon—in the presence of the Chairperson; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the Chairperson is a registered veterinary surgeon—in the presence of any other member of the Board who is not a registered veterinary surgeon.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 70, any of the following persons may be present at the drawing of lots—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a relevant candidate;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other person that the returning officer considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: The returning officer must notify each of the relevant candidates—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: of the place, date and time of the drawing of lots; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that, subject to section 70, the candidate may be present at the drawing of lots.

subsection.content: The presence or absence of any person, other than the person required to be present under subsection (4), at the drawing of lots does not affect the validity of the result.

section.name: s46
section.heading: Candidate obtaining zero vote not to be declared elected
section.content: A candidate who has obtained zero vote at a poll must not be declared to be elected as an elected member.

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at least one candidate obtains one or more votes at a poll; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the result of the election is ascertained under section 42.

subsection.leadIn: The returning officer must—

subparagraph.content: the number of votes (including zero vote) recorded for every candidate;
which candidate is elected as an elected member;
the result of the election (including the number of remaining vacancies, if any); and
that the election is concluded; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: send a copy of the notice to every elector.

subsection.content: The returning officer must also notify the Board in writing of the number of remaining vacancies, if any.
If the election is an ordinary election, and there is one or more remaining vacancies, a by-election is to be held by the Board to fill the remaining vacancies.
If the election is a by-election, and there is one or more remaining vacancies, subject to subsection (6), a further round of by-election is to be held by the Board to fill the remaining vacancies.

A by-election may be held under subsection (5) only if the period beginning on the date on which the result of the election is declared under subsection (2) and ending on the specified end date is not less than 9 months.

section.name: s48
section.heading: Election countermanded if no candidate obtains any vote

subsection.content: This section applies if no candidate obtains any vote at a poll.

subsection.leadIn: The returning officer must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by written notice, declare that the election is countermanded because no candidate obtains any vote at the poll; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: send a copy of the notice to every elector.

subsection.content: The returning officer must also notify the Board in writing that the election is countermanded.
If the election is an ordinary election, a further round of ordinary election is to be held by the Board to fill the vacancies.
If the election is a by-election, subject to subsection (6), a further round of by-election is to be held by the Board to fill the vacancies.
A by-election may be held under subsection (5) only if the period beginning on the date of the declaration under subsection (2) and ending on the specified end date is not less than 9 months.

section.name: s49
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 5
section.def: review committee (檢討委員會) means a review committee established under section 50(1) or 54(2)(a);
S for EE (環生局局長) means the Secretary for Environment and Ecology. (L.N. 144 of 2022)

section.name: s50
section.heading: Establishment and dissolution of review committee

subsection.content: Before the date of the notice of election for an election, a review committee is to be established to hear any election petition presented in relation to the election.

subsection.leadIn: A review committee is dissolved if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: no election petition was presented in relation to the election before the date and time specified under section 57(1)(d);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: one or more election petitions were so presented and all of them have been disposed of; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the S for EE approves an application under section 54(1) in relation to the review committee. (L.N. 144 of 2022)

subsection.content: A review committee is to consist of 5 persons appointed under subsection (2).
The S for EE may appoint any person (including a member of the Board) who is not a registered veterinary surgeon to be a member of a review committee. (L.N. 144 of 2022)
The S for EE must appoint one of the members of a review committee to be the convenor of the committee. (L.N. 144 of 2022)
The convenor is to preside at the meetings of the review committee.
On receiving an election petition, the Chairperson must notify every person who signed the petition of the composition of the review committee.

subsection.leadIn: A matter arising at a meeting of a review committee is to be determined by a majority of votes of the members of the committee present and voting on the matter if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the members fail to reach a consensus on the matter; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any of the members requests a voting.

subsection.content: The convenor of the review committee has an original vote, and also, if there is an equality of votes for a matter, a casting vote.
Subject to this Part, the proceedings of a review committee, and other matters (whether or not procedural) concerning a review committee, are to be provided for in the rules.
The composition of a review committee may be questioned by a written application for changing the composition of the committee.
The application may only be made on the ground that the composition of the review committee poses a real risk of partiality or bias as regards the decision of the committee.

subsection.leadIn: The application may be made either—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: jointly by the electors who have jointly presented an election petition in relation to the election; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by a person described in section 56(1)(b) or (c) who has presented an election petition in relation to the election.

subsection.leadIn: The application must satisfy the following conditions—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it sets out the ground for the application;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is in the specified form;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: it is completed, and submitted, in accordance with the rules; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: it is received by the S for EE after the date specified under section 57(1)(d) and before the date and time specified by the Board. (L.N. 144 of 2022)

subsection.content: The date specified under subsection (4)(d) must be at least 7 days after the date specified under section 57(1)(d).

subsection.leadIn: On receiving an application under section 53 in relation to a review committee, the S for EE— (L.N. 144 of 2022)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must consider the application and determine whether to approve or reject the application; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must issue a written notice of the determination to every applicant.

subsection.leadIn: If the S for EE approves the application— (L.N. 144 of 2022)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the S for EE may make appointments under section 51 to establish another review committee; and (L.N. 144 of 2022)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Chairperson must notify every person who signed an election petition for the election of the composition of the new review committee.

subsection.leadIn: An election may only be questioned by presenting an election petition on the ground that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a person declared under Part 3 or 4 to be elected as an elected member was not duly elected because—

subparagraph.content: the person was, under section 13, not eligible for nomination when the person was nominated;

at any time after the nomination of the person but before the person was declared under Part 3 or 4 to be elected as an elected member, there was any of the circumstances specified in section 75 in relation to the person; or
the person has engaged in corrupt or illegal conduct within the meaning of the Schedule in relation to the election;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person determined under section 15(1), 16 or 24 to be not validly nominated as a candidate for the election should have been determined to be validly nominated;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a person (other than the person mentioned in paragraph (a)) has engaged in corrupt or illegal conduct within the meaning of the Schedule in relation to the election; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: material irregularity occurred in relation to the election.

subsection.content: No election petition may be presented in relation to an election that is declared under Part 3 or 4 to be countermanded.

subsection.leadIn: An election petition may be presented—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: jointly by 10 or more electors for the election;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by a remaining candidate for the election; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by a person who is determined under section 15(1), 16 or 24 to be not validly nominated as a candidate for the election.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (1)(b)—
subsection.def: remaining candidate (剩餘候選人) has the meaning given by section 19(3).

subsection.leadIn: An election petition must satisfy the following conditions—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is in the specified form;

subparagraph.content: if it is presented jointly by electors—each of the electors; or
if it is presented by a person described in section 56(1)(b) or (c)—the person;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: it is completed, and presented, in accordance with the rules; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: it is received by the Chairperson after the notification date for the election and before the date and time specified by the Board.

subsection.content: The date specified under subsection (1)(d) must be at least 30 days after the notification date for the election.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: notification date (公布日期) means the date on which notification is given under section 3B(2) of the Ordinance in respect of all persons elected as elected members in an election.

subsection.content: On receiving an election petition in relation to an election, the Chairperson must determine whether or not to reject the petition.
The election petition must be rejected by the Chairperson if section 56 or 57 is not complied with in relation to the petition.
The Chairperson is to forward the election petition to the review committee if the Chairperson is satisfied that sections 56 and 57 are complied with in relation to the petition.
An election petition in relation to an election is to be heard by the review committee in accordance with the rules.
Subject to this Part, the procedural matters concerning an election petition, and matters concerning the hearing of an election petition, are to be provided for in the rules.

subsection.leadIn: At any time before the hearing of an election petition by a review committee begins, the petition may be withdrawn by giving the Chairperson a written notice of withdrawal that is signed by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the petition is presented jointly by electors—each of the electors; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the petition is presented by a person described in section 56(1)(b) or (c)—the person.

subsection.leadIn: A notice of withdrawal must be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: completed, and given, in accordance with the rules.

section.name: s60
section.heading: Hearing may only begin after certain dates
section.leadIn: The hearing of an election petition may only begin—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: after the date specified under section 53(4)(d); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if one or more applications have been made under section 53 in relation to the review committee—after the S for EE has determined all the applications. (L.N. 144 of 2022)

subsection.leadIn: As soon as practicable after hearing an election petition, the review committee must determine—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether the ground for presenting the petition has been proved; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whether a person declared under Part 3 or 4 to be elected as an elected member was duly elected.

subsection.content: If the review committee determines that a person who was declared under Part 4 to be elected was not duly elected, it must further determine whether another person who was not declared under Part 4 to be elected was duly elected.
In determining under subsection (2) whether another person was duly elected, the review committee must act in conformity with the rules.
The review committee may also make in relation to the election petition any other determination that it considers appropriate.
The review committee must notify the Board and the Secretary in writing of the committee’s determination under this section.
A determination made under this section is final.

If the review committee determines under section 61(1)(b) that a person declared under Part 3 or 4 to be elected was not duly elected, the person ceases to hold the office of an elected member on the date of the determination.

If the review committee determines under section 61(1)(b) that a person declared under Part 3 to be elected was not duly elected, or determines under section 61(2) that no other person was duly elected, a by-election is to be held by the Board to fill the vacancy.

Despite subsection (2), a by-election may be held under that subsection only if the period beginning on the date of the determination under section 61(1)(b) and ending on the specified end date is not less than 9 months.

section.name: s63
section.heading: Publishing review committee’s determination in Gazette
section.leadIn: The Secretary must publish the following matters in the Gazette—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the review committee determines under section 61(1)(b) that a person was not duly elected—the person ceases to hold the office of an elected member on the date of the determination;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the review committee determines under section 61(2) that another person was duly elected—the other person was duly elected and the name of that other person;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if a by-election is to be held under section 62—a by-election is to be held to fill the vacancy; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: if a by-election is not to be held under section 62—a by-election is not to be held to fill the vacancy.

section.name: s64
section.heading: Successful election petition does not invalidate previous acts
section.content: A determination under section 61(1)(b) by a review committee that a person declared under Part 3 or 4 to be elected was not duly elected does not invalidate any act done by the person in the capacity of an elected member before the determination.

division.name: D1
division.heading: Functions of Board and Appointment of Returning Officers etc.

section.name: s65
section.heading: Board to conduct and supervise election

subsection.content: The Board is responsible for the conduct and supervision of an election.
However, if a member of the Board is nominated as a candidate for an election, the member must not participate in the business of the Board relating to the conduct and supervision of the election.

section.name: s66
section.heading: Board to specify forms
section.content: The Board may specify any form for the purposes of this Regulation in the rules.

subsection.content: There is to be 1 returning officer for every election.
The returning officer is to be appointed by the Board.

subsection.leadIn: The following person may not be appointed under subsection (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a member of the Board; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a registered veterinary surgeon.

subsection.content: The Board may appoint one or more assistant returning officers for an election.

subsection.leadIn: The following person may not be appointed under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a member of the Board; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a registered veterinary surgeon.

subsection.content: An assistant returning officer for an election may, with the authority of the returning officer, perform the functions of the returning officer under this Regulation (except sections 14, 31, 32, 33 and 34).

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (3)—
subsection.def: function (職能) includes powers and duties.

section.name: s69
section.heading: Determination of specified officer is final
section.content: Subject to Part 5, a determination of a specified officer made under this Regulation is final.

section.name: s70
section.heading: Returning officer to keep order at places of election

subsection.leadIn: For an election, the returning officer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must keep order at places of election; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may order a person to leave a place of election immediately if, at the place, the person behaves in a disorderly manner.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: place of election (選舉地點) means—(a)a place of counting the votes under Part 4;(b)a place of drawing lots under section 45; or(c)a place of sealing a ballot box under section 71.

section.name: s71
section.heading: Returning officer to keep ballot papers etc.

subsection.leadIn: The returning officer must keep, in accordance with the rules—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: every ballot paper received by the officer; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: every ballot box used in the election.

subsection.content: As soon as practicable after the end of the polling period, the returning officer must seal every ballot box in accordance with the rules.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 70, any of the following persons may be present when a ballot box is sealed—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a remaining candidate;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other person that the returning officer considers appropriate.

subsection.content: The returning officer must keep every sealed ballot box under the officer’s control until the counting of votes begins.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (3)(a)—
subsection.def: remaining candidate (剩餘候選人) has the meaning given by section 19(3).

subsection.leadIn: The returning officer must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: keep in safe custody all documents received by the officer in relation to the election for a period of 3 months beginning on the relevant date; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: unless directed by an order of court, destroy those documents after the end of the period.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: document (文件) includes an envelope;

relevant date (有關日期) means—(a)if the election has been declared under Part 3 or 4 to be countermanded—the date of the declaration;(b)if paragraph (a) does not apply and no election petition has been presented in relation to the election before the date and time specified under section 57(1)(d)—the date specified under that section;(c)if only 1 election petition has been presented in relation to the election before the date and time specified under section 57(1)(d)—the date on which the petition is withdrawn under section 59 or otherwise disposed of under Part 5; and(d)if 2 or more election petitions have been presented in relation to the election before the date and time specified under section 57(1)(d)—the date on which the petitions are withdrawn under section 59 or otherwise disposed of under Part 5 or, if the petitions are so withdrawn or disposed of on different dates, the last of those dates.

subsection.leadIn: If any of the following periods ends on a day that is an inclement weather warning day, that period is extended and is to end on the first following normal working day—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the nomination period;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the polling period.

subsection.leadIn: If any of the following dates falls on a day that is an inclement weather warning day, the first following normal working day is taken to be that day—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date specified under section 53(4)(d);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date specified under section 57(1)(d).

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an act is required or permitted under this Regulation to be done within or during a particular period; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the period ends on a day that is an inclement weather warning day,

subsection.continued: the period is extended and is to end on the first following normal working day.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an act is required or permitted under this Regulation to be done before a time on a particular date; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date falls on a day that is an inclement weather warning day,

subsection.continued: the act is required or permitted to be done before the time on the first following normal working day.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a working day is an inclement weather warning day if at any time on the day there is in force—

subparagraph.content: a gale warning within the meaning of section 2 of the Judicial Proceedings (Adjournment During Gale Warnings) Ordinance (Cap. 62); or
a rainstorm warning within the meaning of that section; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the first following normal working day is, in relation to a period under subsection (1) or (3) or a date under subsection (2) or (4), the first working day after the period or the date that is not an inclement weather warning day.

section.name: s74
section.heading: Term of office of member elected in by-election or determined elected under section 61(2)

subsection.leadIn: The term of office of a member elected in a by-election—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: begins immediately after the result of the election is declared under Part 3 or 4; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: ends on the specified end date.

subsection.leadIn: The term of office of a person determined to be duly elected under section 61(2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: begins immediately after the determination; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: ends on the specified end date.

subsection.leadIn: The following circumstances are specified for the purposes of sections 15(3)(b)(iii), 16(1)(b)(iii), 24(1)(b)(iii), 37(1)(c), 38(1)(c) and 55(1)(a)(ii)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of the person is not on the register;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person does not hold a practising certificate;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the person is an undischarged bankrupt;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: there is in force a voluntary arrangement within the meaning of the Bankruptcy Ordinance (Cap. 6) between the person and the person’s creditors;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the person is reprimanded under section 19(c) of the Ordinance;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: an order under section 19(d) of the Ordinance is made in respect of the person;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the person is sentenced to imprisonment for a term exceeding 3 months;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: the person is convicted of an offence of having engaged in corrupt conduct or illegal conduct in contravention of Cap. 554.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1)(g), it does not matter—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether the person is sentenced in Hong Kong or in any other place;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whether the sentence is suspended or not; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: what the imprisonment is called.

section.name: s1
section.content: A person engages in corrupt or illegal conduct in relation to an election if, had the election been an election to which Cap. 554 applies, the person would have engaged, or would have been taken to have engaged, in corrupt conduct or illegal conduct under section 7, 8, 9, 10, 11 (excluding subsection (8)), 12, 13(1), (2) or (3), 14, 17(1)(a), (d) or (e), 21 or 25 of Cap. 554.

section.name: s2
section.leadIn: A person also engages in corrupt or illegal conduct in relation to an election if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person makes a request under section 31 or 33 in the name of another person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person, having voted at the election, makes a request under section 31 or 33 in the person’s own name;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the person votes at the election more than once;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: the person invites or induces another person—

subparagraph.content: to vote at the election knowing that the other person is not entitled to do so; or
to vote at the election more than once; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the person makes or publishes a materially false or misleading statement of fact about a candidate for the purpose of promoting or prejudicing the election of the candidate.

section.name: s3
section.content: A person does not engage in corrupt or illegal conduct under section 2(e) of this Schedule if the person proves that the person had reasonable grounds for believing, and did believe, that the statement was true when the statement was made or published.

section.name: s4
section.leadIn: In section 2(a) of this Schedule, a reference to another person includes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person who has died; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a fictitious person.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a candidate is a person who stands nominated as a candidate for an election;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a statement of fact about a candidate includes a statement concerning the character, qualifications or previous conduct of the candidate.
